newsitem.title: FRANCE: EP demands appeals procedure for asylum seekers.
newsitem.headline: EP demands appeals procedure for asylum seekers.

text.p: The European Parliament demanded on Thursday that an independent appeals procedure be set up for political refugees whose asylum requests are turned down.
The parliament adopted the report of Dutch Socialist Deputy Hedy d'Ancona which said an independent legislative body and not border guards should consider the appeals.
The EU tightened its asylum rules in a bid to avoid bogus requests following the rapid rise in the number of people trying to seek refuge in Europe.
D'Ancona was reporting on a Council resolution aimed at providing minimum guarantees for asylum seekers. She said the resolution failed to live up to its title.
The report said that appeals should be considered as quickly as possible.
